Literature Review: Cognitive flexibility is a crucial executive function that enables individuals to adapt to changing environmental demands and supports optimal life outcomes. The development of cognitive flexibility has been extensively studied using task-based functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI), which has provided valuable insights into the neural mechanisms underlying this complex cognitive process. This literature review aims to update the current understanding of cognitive flexibility development and discuss future directions for research in this area.
